sentences.en: And at the very least, doesn't he deserve one more league - wide ovation?
sentences.cn: 难道他丝毫不值得整个联盟的为他再欢呼一次 吗 ?

sentences.en: Fans gave the rock group a thunderous ovation.
sentences.cn: 歌迷对这个摇滚乐队报以雷鸣般的掌声。

sentences.en: He gets a standing ovation as he moves off stage.
sentences.cn: 他离开舞台时,全体观众起立热烈鼓掌.

sentences.en: Menuhin's playing was attended by a 15 - minute standing ovation.
sentences.cn: 梅纽因的演奏结束之后,听众起立鼓掌15分钟.
她受到了极其热烈的欢迎.

sentences.en: She received an enthusiastic ovation from the audience.
sentences.cn: 她获得观众热烈的欢迎.

sentences.en: The audience rose as one in a standing ovation.
sentences.cn: 全场观众一齐起立鼓掌.

sentences.en: The Chancellor’s entrance was greeted with a standing ovation (= everyone stood up ).
sentences.cn: 总理进来时，全体起立鼓掌欢迎。

sentences.en: The final piece won her a rapturous ovation from the audience.
sentences.cn: 最后一支曲子为她赢得了观众的热烈掌声.

sentences.en: The hero received a great ovation from the crowd.
sentences.cn: 那位英雄受到人群的热烈欢迎.

sentences.en: The show won a standing ovation.
sentences.cn: 这场演出赢得全场起立鼓掌.

sentences.en: The singer got a ten - minute standing ovation.
sentences.cn: 观众起立向那位歌手鼓掌达十分钟.

sentences.en: When he rose to speak, he was accorded a prolonged ovation.
sentences.cn: 当他起立发言时, 响起了经久不息的掌声.

sentences.en: When host and guest appeared, they received a standing ovation.
sentences.cn: 宾主走进来进大家都起立鼓掌.

sentences.en: When she walked onstage she was given a standing ovation.
sentences.cn: 当她走上台时，观众起立鼓掌欢迎。

sentences.en: When the orchestra conductor appeared on stage, he received a standing ovation.
sentences.cn: 那位乐团指挥出现在舞台时, 得到全场起立喝采.

sentences.en: You've got a standing ovation going on here, get on and acknowledge it.
sentences.cn: 这儿这么多人在为你热烈鼓掌呢, 赶快致谢吧!

phrases.tran_cn: 长时间起立鼓掌；起立致敬

trans.tran_cn: 热烈欢迎，热烈的鼓掌，欢呼
trans.tran_en: if a group of people give someone an ovation, they clap to show approval
